statements.name: PROC ODSTEXT
statements.help:
PROC ODSTEXT <CONTENTS=text-string><DATA=SAS-data-set><NAME=template-name>
	<PAGEBREAK=NO | YES><PRINT><=template-store>;STOREBY <DESCENDING>variable-1
	<… <DESCENDING> variable-n>
	<NOTSORTED>;CELLSTYLE expression-1AS <style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)] >
	<, expression-n AS  <style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>>;DYNAMIC variable-name-1<=value–1<'text-1'>>
	<variable-name-2<=value-2><'text-2' ...>>;HEADING <n><“heading-text”> / <STYLE=style-override>MVAR variable-name-1<=value–1<'text-1'>>
	<variable-name-2<=value-2><'text-2' ...>>;NMVAR variable-name-1<=value–1<'text-1'>>
	<variable-name-2<=value-2><'text-2' ...>>;LIST  / <START =integer-value><STYLE =style-override> ;
	ITEM <expression> / <FORMAT =format-name>
		<STYLE =style-override>
		<VALUE =integer-value>;END ;P expression/ <FORMAT =format-name><STYLE =style-override> ;TRANSLATE expression-1INTO expression-2< , expression-n INTO  expression-m;>

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: specifies the title for the table of contents. The CONTENTS= option overrides the generated table of contents text.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS data set.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies that the content of the procedure should be saved as a template with the specified name.

arguments.name: PAGEBREAK=
arguments.description: specifies whether the procedure should generate a page break.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that no page break is generated.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that a page break is generated.

arguments.name: PRINT
arguments.description: specifies that the template is printed as well as stored.

arguments.name: STORE=
arguments.description: specifies the template store where the compiled template is placed. If you do not specify a name or template store, ODS stores the template in the first writable template store in the ODS path. By default, this template store is Sasuser.Templat.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

statements.name: CELLSTYLE
statements.description: For tables, sets the style element of the cells in the table or column according to the values of the variables. For text, sets the style attributes of the list items or paragraphs. Use this statement to set the presentation characteristics (such as foreground color and font face) of individual cells or text.

arguments.name: AS
arguments.description: specifies the style to apply to table cells or text. You can specify multiple AS arguments.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as the name of a column or symbols that are declared in a DYNAMIC, MVAR, or NMVAR statement in the current template.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: specifies a SAS function.

arguments.name: _COLUMN_
arguments.description: is a column number. Column numbering begins with 1.

arguments.name: _DATANAME_
arguments.description: is a data column name.

arguments.name: _DATATYPE_
arguments.description: is the data type of the column variable. The data type is either numeric ("num") or character ("char").

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is a column label.

arguments.name: _ROW_
arguments.description: is a row number. Row numbering begins with 1.

arguments.name: _STYLE_
arguments.description: is a style element name.

arguments.name: _VAL_
arguments.description: is the data value of a cell.

arguments.name: comparison-operator
arguments.description: compares a variable with a value or with another variable.

arguments.name: style-attribute-specification
arguments.description: describes a style attribute to set.

arguments.name: style-element-name
arguments.description: is the name of a style element that is part of a style that is registered with the Output Delivery System.

statements.name: DYNAMIC
statements.description: Defines a symbol that references a value that the data component supplies from the procedure or DATA step.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names a variable that the data component supplies. ODS resolves the value of the variable when it binds the template and the data component.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: sets the value of the variable.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: is text that is placed in the template to explain the dynamic variable's use. Text of this type becomes part of the compiled template, which you can view with the SOURCE statement, whereas SAS comments do not.

statements.name: HEADING
statements.description: Creates H# tags for the ODSTEXT output.

arguments.name: heading-text
arguments.description: specifies the heading text. You can use in-line formatting and style overrides to customize your heading text. This option helps to make reports accessible for people with a wide range of abilities.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the heading level.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: specifies the style element to use for the heading text.

arguments.name: style-element-name
arguments.description: is the name of a style element that is part of a style template that is registered with the Output Delivery System. SAS provides some style templates. You can create your own style templates with PROC TEMPLATE.

arguments.name: style-attribute-name
arguments.description: specifies the attribute to change.

arguments.name: style-attribute-value
arguments.description: specifies a value for the attribute. Each attribute has a different set of valid values.

statements.name: ITEM
statements.description: Specifies an item to be added to the item list. An ITEM statement that does not specify an expression begins an item block.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value, such as the name of a column, a text string, or symbols that are declared in a DYNAMIC, MVAR, or NMVAR statement in the current template.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: specifies a SAS function.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies a default format for the value in each table cell or list item. You can use any SAS or user-defined format.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: specifies the style element to use for the specified item.

arguments.name: style-element-name
arguments.description: is the name of a style element that is part of a style template that is registered with the Output Delivery System. SAS provides some style templates. You can create your own style templates with PROC TEMPLATE.

arguments.name: style-attribute-name
arguments.description: specifies the attribute to change.

arguments.name: style-attribute-value
arguments.description: specifies a value for the attribute. Each attribute has a different set of valid values.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: starts a numbered list from the specified integer-value. If another VALUE= option is specified in subsequent statements, numbering begins again at that point.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: starts a numbered list from the specified integer-value. If another START= option is specified in subsequent statements, the numbering begins again at that point.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: specifies the style element to use for the items in the list.

arguments.name: style-element-name
arguments.description: is the name of a style element that is part of a style template that is registered with the Output Delivery System. SAS provides some style templates. You can create your own style templates with PROC TEMPLATE.

arguments.name: style-attribute-name
arguments.description: specifies the attribute to change.

arguments.name: style-attribute-value
arguments.description: specifies a value for the attribute. Each attribute has a different set of valid values.

statements.name: MVAR
statements.description: Defines a symbol that references a macro variable. ODS uses the value of the variable as a string. References to the macro variable are resolved when ODS binds the template and the data component to produce an output object.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names a macro variable to reference in the template. ODS uses the value of the macro variable as a string. ODS does not resolve the value of the macro variable until it binds the template and the data component.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: sets the default variable value.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: is text that is placed in the template to explain the macro variable's use. Text of this type becomes part of the compiled template, which you can view with the SOURCE statement, whereas SAS comments do not.

statements.name: NMVAR
statements.description: Defines a symbol that references a macro variable. ODS converts the variable's value to a number (stored as a double) before using it. References to the macro variable are resolved when ODS binds the template and the data component to produce an output object.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names a macro variable to reference in the template. ODS converts the variable's value to a number (stored as a double) before using it. ODS does not resolve the macro variable until it binds the template and the data component.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: sets the value of the variable.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: is text that is placed in the template to explain the macro variable's use. Text of this type becomes part of the compiled template, which you can view with the SOURCE statement, whereas SAS comments do not.

statements.name: P
statements.description: Specifies a paragraph. Multiple P statements are allowed within an item block.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value, such as the name of a column, text string, or symbols that are declared in a DYNAMIC, MVAR, or NMVAR statement in the current template.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: specifies a SAS function.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies a default format for the value in each paragraph. You can use any SAS or user-defined format.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: specifies the style element to use for the items in the list or paragraph.

arguments.name: style-element-name
arguments.description: is the name of a style element that is part of a style template that is registered with the Output Delivery System. SAS provides some style templates. You can create your own style templates with PROC TEMPLATE.

arguments.name: style-attribute-name
arguments.description: specifies the attribute to change.

arguments.name: style-attribute-value
arguments.description: specifies a value for the attribute. Each attribute has a different set of valid values.

statements.name: TRANSLATE
statements.description: Translates the specified numeric values to other values.

arguments.name: INTO
arguments.description: specifies the value to replace. You can specify multiple INTO arguments.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as the name of a column or symbols that are declared in a DYNAMIC, MVAR, or NMVAR statement in the current template.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: specifies a SAS function.

arguments.name: _COLUMN_
arguments.description: is a column number. Column numbering begins with 1.

arguments.name: _DATANAME_
arguments.description: is a data column name.

arguments.name: _DATATYPE_
arguments.description: is the data type of the column variable. The data type is either numeric ("num") or character ("char").

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is a column label.

arguments.name: _ROW_
arguments.description: is a row number. Row numbering begins with 1.

arguments.name: _STYLE_
arguments.description: is a style element name.

arguments.name: _VAL_
arguments.description: is the data value of a cell.

arguments.name: comparison-operator
arguments.description: compares a variable with a value or with another variable.
